metadata.methodology: v3 - Pure giving ratio (no red flags, no pledge penalties)
metadata.giving_ratio_formula: Giving Ratio = Total Lifetime Giving / (Net Worth × Liquidity Factor)

rankings.name: Changpeng Zhao
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Minimal philanthropy. Crypto wealth volatile. Pled guilty to money laundering charges 2024.

rankings.name: Vlad Tenev
rankings.notes: Bulgarian-American. Co-founder with Baiju Bhatt. GameStop saga controversy. Young billionaire with minimal philanthropy track record.

rankings.name: Robert Pera
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Extremely low philanthropy. One of least generous tech billionaires.

rankings.name: Eduardo Saverin
rankings.notes: Renounced US citizenship 2011. Singapore richest person. Brazilian-born

rankings.name: Jensen Huang
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Foundation has billions but mostly funds DAFs, not actual charities. Very low actual giving relative to $137B wealth.

rankings.name: Elon Musk
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge 2012. Foundation assets of $14B represent warehoused wealth, not deployed charity. External grants minimal.

rankings.name: Iris Fontbona
rankings.notes: Widow of Andrónico Luksic. Controls Quiñenco and Antofagasta mining. Richest woman in Chile and Latin America. Extremely private.

rankings.name: Ernest Garcia III
rankings.notes: Stanford engineer. Spun Carvana out of father's DriveTime. Very volatile wealth (stock swings).

rankings.name: Ken Fisher
rankings.notes: Fisher Investments founder. Forbes columnist for 32 years. Known for frugality (drives same car 25+ years). Plans posthumous giving, minimal lifetime giving.

rankings.name: Robin Zeng
rankings.notes: Founder/chairman of CATL - world's largest EV battery maker. Supplies Tesla, BMW, etc. Very understated lifestyle for his wealth level.

rankings.name: Jacqueline Mars
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Extremely private. One of least generous billionaires relative to wealth.

rankings.name: Thomas Peterffy
rankings.notes: Has NOT signed Giving Pledge. Prefers direct giving over foundation structure. Limited public philanthropy record.

rankings.name: Huang Shilin
rankings.notes: Former vice chairman of CATL - world's largest EV battery supplier. Co-founder alongside Robin Zeng.

rankings.name: Alain Wertheimer
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Extremely private. Chanel is private company. Limited public philanthropy documented.

rankings.name: Emmanuel Besnier
rankings.notes: CEO of Lactalis - world's largest dairy company. Notoriously secretive. Rarely gives interviews. Has private box with tinted glass at football stadium.

rankings.name: Germán Larrea Mota-Velasco
rankings.notes: CEO of Grupo México, Mexico's largest mining corporation. Third largest copper producer globally. Extremely private.

rankings.name: Nathan Blecharczyk
rankings.notes: Airbnb Chief Strategy Officer. Signed Giving Pledge 2016 with wife Elizabeth. Focus on children's potential and transformative ideas.

rankings.name: Zhong Shanshan
rankings.notes: Has NOT signed Giving Pledge. Very private. Limited English-language philanthropy coverage.

rankings.name: Charles Ergen
rankings.notes: Wealth declined significantly from ~$20B. Signed Giving Pledge 2018

rankings.name: Susanne Klatten
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Germany's richest woman. Low philanthropy relative to $24B wealth.

rankings.name: Ernest Garcia II
rankings.notes: 1990 felony bank fraud conviction (Lincoln S&L). Son founded Carvana. Low-profile philanthropy through family foundation.

rankings.name: Wang Wei
rankings.notes: Founder/chairman of SF Express - China's leading courier. Started as illegal cross-border delivery. Over 400K employees. Extremely private.

rankings.name: Bernard Arnault
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. World's richest (or 2nd richest). EXTREMELY low philanthropy. Guardian: 'practically nothing' in giving.

rankings.name: Kim Kardashian
rankings.notes: In-kind donations significant. Baby2Baby board member since 2013. Criminal justice reform advocacy (not counted as charity).

rankings.name: Charlene de Carvalho-Heineken
rankings.notes: Inherited 25% controlling stake in Heineken from father Freddy Heineken in 2002. Richest woman in Netherlands. Family sits on Heineken boards.

rankings.name: John Menard Jr
rankings.notes: Has NOT signed Giving Pledge. Known for tight control of business and limited philanthropy relative to wealth.

rankings.name: Giovanni Ferrero
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Extremely private. Low public philanthropy relative to $45B wealth. Ferrero family philosophy: 'Work, Create, Donate'.

rankings.name: John Mars
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Very private. Minimal philanthropy relative to massive wealth. One of the least generous billionaires.

rankings.name: Qin Yinglin
rankings.notes: Chair/president of Muyuan Foodstuff. Started with 22 pigs in 1992. Now 80M pig capacity annually. World's richest farmer.

rankings.name: Pang Kang
rankings.notes: Chairman of Foshan Haitian - China's largest soy sauce maker. Over 300 food products. Named Outstanding Entrepreneur of Guangdong Province.

rankings.name: Tadashi Yanai
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Japan's richest person. Modest philanthropy relative to $48B wealth. Focus on education/culture.

rankings.name: Theo Albrecht Jr.
rankings.notes: Aldi Nord and Trader Joe's owner. Son of Aldi co-founder. Extremely private. Father was kidnapped 1971. Family avoids publicity entirely.

rankings.name: David Thomson
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Canada's richest person. Major art collector. Philanthropy modest relative to $71B wealth.

rankings.name: Francoise Bettencourt Meyers
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. World's richest woman. Foundation active but giving low relative to $80B wealth.

rankings.name: Ira Rennert
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Known for extravagant lifestyle. Minimal philanthropy relative to wealth.

rankings.name: Beate Heister
rankings.notes: Daughter of Karl Albrecht Sr., co-founder of Aldi. Controls Aldi Süd with brother Karl Jr. through Siepmann trust. Extremely private.

rankings.name: William Ding
rankings.notes: Has NOT signed Giving Pledge. Low philanthropy profile.

rankings.name: Israel Englander
rankings.notes: Low profile philanthropist. Millennium manages $70B+

rankings.name: Amancio Ortega
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Major Spanish health donor. Low giving relative to $90B wealth.

rankings.name: Daniel Ek
rankings.notes: Swedish. Signed Giving Pledge 2013. Focus on education, sustainability, tech access. Note: $1B deeptech investment is venture, not charity.

rankings.name: Diane Hendricks
rankings.notes: ABC Supply co-founder/chair. Richest self-made woman in US (Forbes). Widowed 2007. Focus on revitalizing hometown Beloit. Large political donor.

rankings.name: Lakshmi Mittal
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Very low giving relative to wealth. Prospect Magazine noted lack of philanthropic instinct compared to Carnegie.

rankings.name: Rupert Murdoch
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Very low philanthropy relative to wealth and tenure. Political donations far exceed charitable.

rankings.name: David Shaw
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Quant hedge fund pioneer. Jeff Bezos worked for him. Modest philanthropy focused on elite schools.

rankings.name: Gina Rinehart
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Australia's richest person. Mining heiress. Low philanthropy relative to $30B wealth.

rankings.name: Larry Ellison
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. Recently pledged 95% of fortune. Current giving low relative to wealth but accelerating.

rankings.name: Jeff Yass
rankings.notes: Co-founder of Susquehanna trading. Registered Libertarian. Major political donor. School choice advocate. Holds large TikTok stake.

rankings.name: Larry Page
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge 2010. Google co-founder. Extremely private. Low philanthropy relative to wealth despite pledge.

rankings.name: Zhang Yiming
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Stepped down as CEO 2021. Focus on education philanthropy. Minimal public giving relative to $49B wealth.

rankings.name: Mukesh Ambani
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Asia's richest person. Reliance Foundation very active but giving is modest relative to $116B wealth.

rankings.name: Abigail Johnson
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Third-generation wealth. Runs Fidelity Charitable but personal giving relatively modest.

rankings.name: Marc Rowan
rankings.notes: Apollo CEO since 2021. Wharton chair of board. Led donor pushback on Penn over antisemitism. Jewish causes and education focus.

rankings.name: John Collison
rankings.notes: Irish. Harvard dropout. Works closely with brother Patrick on philanthropy. Focus on science acceleration.

rankings.name: Julia Koch
rankings.notes: Inherited wealth from David Koch (2019). David was major philanthropist.

rankings.name: Drew Houston
rankings.notes: MIT dropout. Y Combinator alum. Giving Pledge 2023. Education and disaster relief focus.

rankings.name: Joe Gebbia
rankings.notes: RISD grad. Most philanthropically active of Airbnb founders. Focus on ocean cleanup, girls education, homelessness.

rankings.name: Li Shufu
rankings.notes: Founder/chairman of Geely. Acquired Volvo for $1.5B in 2010. Major Daimler shareholder. From Taizhou, Zhejiang.

rankings.name: Francois Pinault
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. French luxury billionaire. Major art collector. Notre-Dame pledge was high-profile.

rankings.name: Peter Thiel
rankings.notes: Has NOT signed Giving Pledge. Mix of philanthropy and political giving. Contrarian approach to giving.

rankings.name: Melanie Perkins
rankings.notes: Australian. Youngest female self-made billionaire at time. Pledged 80% of personal wealth. Married to co-founder Cliff Obrecht.

rankings.name: Cliff Obrecht
rankings.notes: Australian. COO of Canva. Married to Melanie Perkins. Joint philanthropy.

rankings.name: Reinhold Wuerth
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Major art collector. Foundation for education and culture. Low giving relative to $34B wealth.

rankings.name: Vinod Khosla
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. Focus on climate and clean energy. Impact investing approach.

rankings.name: Vagit Alekperov
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Former Lukoil CEO. Russian oligarch. Philanthropy limited and difficult to verify.

rankings.name: Travis Kalanick
rankings.notes: Controversial former Uber CEO. Left board 2019. Sold $2.5B in shares

rankings.name: Patrick Collison
rankings.notes: Irish. Youngest self-made billionaire at time (2016). Focus on science acceleration, housing policy. Fast Grants co-founder.

rankings.name: Masayoshi Son
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Major disaster relief donor but limited ongoing philanthropy. Wealth volatile due to SoftBank investments.

rankings.name: Robin Li
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Moderate philanthropy. Focus on education and disaster relief.

rankings.name: Robert Bass
rankings.notes: One of four Bass brothers. Yale grad. Foundation focuses on Fort Worth area. Steady, low-profile philanthropy.

rankings.name: Brian Acton
rankings.notes: WhatsApp co-founder with Jan Koum. Founded Signal Foundation. 'Delete Facebook' advocate

rankings.name: Klaus-Michael Kuehne
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. German logistics billionaire. Kühne Foundation active. Modest giving relative to $33B.

rankings.name: David Tepper
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. Owner of Carolina Panthers. Major Carnegie Mellon donor. Focus on education and disaster relief.

rankings.name: Rupert Johnson Jr.
rankings.notes: Franklin Resources vice chairman. Son of founder Rupert Sr. Major shareholder. Focus on education, especially Washington and Lee.

rankings.name: David Siegel
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. Two Sigma co-founder. Climate tech and education focus.

rankings.name: Stewart Butterfield
rankings.notes: Canadian. Sold Slack to Salesforce for $27.7B (2021). Philosophy degree. Partner is Jen Rubio (Away CEO).

rankings.name: James Goodnight
rankings.notes: Private company founder. Known for employee-friendly workplace. Education focus

rankings.name: Vicky Safra
rankings.notes: Inherited from husband Joseph Safra (died 2020). Greek-Brazilian, lives in Switzerland. Controls J. Safra Sarasin bank.

rankings.name: Nassef Sawiris
rankings.notes: Richest person in Egypt. Runs OCI fertilizer company. Owns stake in Adidas (7%) and Aston Villa FC. Part of prominent Sawiris family.

rankings.name: Jim Walton
rankings.notes: Walton family gives collectively through WFF. Has not individually signed Giving Pledge.

rankings.name: Rob Walton
rankings.notes: Walton family collective giving. Has not signed Giving Pledge.

rankings.name: Daniel Loeb
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. Third Point founder. Focus on education reform and Jewish causes.

rankings.name: Harold Hamm
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. Focus on education and energy research. Oklahoma philanthropist.

rankings.name: Brian Chesky
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. Committed to donate net proceeds of CEO equity. All 3 Airbnb co-founders signed pledge.

rankings.name: Sergey Brin
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge 2010. Major Parkinson's research funder ($1.5B+). More active philanthropist than co-founder Larry Page.

rankings.name: Leon Black
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. Foundation has paused grantmaking. Reputation damaged by Epstein ties.

rankings.name: John Overdeck
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. Quant hedge fund co-founder. Focus on math education.

rankings.name: Thomas Frist Jr
rankings.notes: Has NOT signed Giving Pledge. Frist Foundation active in Nashville. Arts and healthcare focus.

rankings.name: Dieter Schwarz
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. One of world's most private billionaires. Low giving relative to $47B wealth.

rankings.name: Chase Coleman III
rankings.notes: Julian Robertson protégé (Tiger Cub). Very private. Formalized philanthropy 2021

rankings.name: Eric Yuan
rankings.notes: Chinese-born. Visa rejected 8 times before US entry. COVID-19 made Zoom essential

rankings.name: Reid Hoffman
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. Lower net worth but committed. Political and tech philanthropy.

rankings.name: Carl Icahn
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. Major Mount Sinai donor. Medicine, education, child welfare focus.

rankings.name: Stefan Persson
rankings.notes: Former H&M chairman. Expanded H&M globally starting 1982. Family holds 65% stake in H&M. Richest person in Sweden.

rankings.name: Robert Kuok
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Malaysia's richest. Very private. Modest philanthropy relative to wealth.

rankings.name: Leonard Stern
rankings.notes: NYU Stern School namesake. Son of immigrants. Founded homeless services nonprofit. Long-term education philanthropist.

rankings.name: Stephen Schwarzman
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. Focus on education, especially Schwarzman Scholars in China.

rankings.name: Eric Schmidt
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. Schmidt Futures is major science funder. Focus on technology, AI safety, climate. Active in policy circles.

rankings.name: Aliko Dangote
rankings.notes: Has NOT signed Giving Pledge. Africa's richest man. Pledged 25% of wealth. Major African development focus.

rankings.name: Vladimir Potanin
rankings.notes: President of Interros and Norilsk Nickel. First Russian Giving Pledge signatory. Major Russian philanthropist. Under Western sanctions post-2022.

rankings.name: Garrett Camp
rankings.notes: Canadian. Also founded StumbleUpon. Left Uber board but remained observer

rankings.name: Gautam Adani
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Large pledges but actual disbursement lower. 2025 Hurun: Rs 386 crore annual giving.

rankings.name: Patrick Soon-Shiong
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. Some controversy over self-dealing in philanthropy. Cancer research focus.

rankings.name: Bruce Kovner
rankings.notes: Major Juilliard donor. Conservative think tank supporter

rankings.name: Ricardo Salinas Pliego
rankings.notes: Founder/chairman of Grupo Salinas. Owns TV Azteca, Grupo Elektra. Bitcoin advocate. Outspoken libertarian views.

rankings.name: Jan Koum
rankings.notes: Ukrainian-born. Very private. Major Jewish causes megadonor

rankings.name: Alice Walton
rankings.notes: Major arts philanthropist. Crystal Bridges is significant. Has not signed Giving Pledge.

rankings.name: Charles Schwab
rankings.notes: Has NOT signed Giving Pledge. Created major DAF platform but personal giving lower profile.

rankings.name: Jorge Paulo Lemann
rankings.notes: Brazilian billionaire, co-founder of 3G Capital. Major stakeholder in AB InBev, Burger King, Kraft Heinz. Known for aggressive cost-cutting approach.

rankings.name: Ken Griffin
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Major education donor. Forbes Most Generous Givers 2023.

rankings.name: Rihanna
rankings.notes: Barbadian. Named after grandparents Clara and Lionel. Fenty Beauty contributes to foundation. Focus on climate, Caribbean development.

rankings.name: Len Blavatnik
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Blavatnik Family Foundation very active. Focus on science and education.

rankings.name: Miriam Adelson
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Inherited from husband Sheldon Adelson (2021). Major donor to Jewish causes and Israel. Also major Republican political donor.

rankings.name: Joseph Tsai
rankings.notes: Co-founder and chairman of Alibaba. Owns Brooklyn Nets and WNBA Liberty. Yale alumnus. Taiwanese-Canadian.

rankings.name: George Roberts
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. KKR co-founder with Kravis. Education focus.

rankings.name: Daniel Ziff
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Inherited publishing fortune. Environmental focus. Major Democratic donor.

rankings.name: Dirk Ziff
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Ziff publishing heir. Environment/climate focus.

rankings.name: Robert Ziff
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Ziff publishing heir. Third of three brothers.

rankings.name: Henry Sy family
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Philippines' richest family. SM Foundation active since 1983. Modest giving relative to wealth.

rankings.name: Mark Zuckerberg
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge 2010. CZI committed to give 99% of Facebook shares over lifetime. $7.22B granted to date.

rankings.name: Steve Cohen
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. Very generous - $1B+ lifetime. Focus on veterans, children's health, underserved communities.

rankings.name: Bobby Murphy
rankings.notes: Snapchat CTO. More technical co-founder. Lower profile than Spiegel

rankings.name: Jim Kennedy
rankings.notes: Cox Enterprises chairman emeritus. Daughter Alex Taylor now CEO. Focus: education, healthcare, sustainability, conservation. Helped bring 1996 Olympics to Atlanta.

rankings.name: Walton Family (collective)
rankings.notes: NO Waltons have signed Giving Pledge. Give collectively through WFF. $10B+ lifetime but massive wealth.

rankings.name: Herbert Simon
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. Mall billionaire. Indiana-focused philanthropy. Brother David Simon also billionaire.

rankings.name: Robert F. Smith
rankings.notes: First Black American to sign Giving Pledge. Famous Morehouse graduation gift

rankings.name: John Paulson
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. Famous for 'greatest trade ever' (2008 housing bet). Major Harvard donor. Converted to family office 2020.

rankings.name: Paul Tudor Jones
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. Robin Hood Foundation pioneer. Focus on poverty in NYC.

rankings.name: Nicky Oppenheimer
rankings.notes: Former chairman of De Beers. Sold family's 40% stake for $5.2B in 2012. Third generation of Oppenheimer mining dynasty. Strong focus on conservation.

rankings.name: Steve Ballmer
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. One of fastest-growing philanthropies. Very active giver.

rankings.name: Lukas Walton
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Son of John Walton (died 2005). Most philanthropically active of 3rd generation Waltons. Focus on environment/climate.

rankings.name: Bill Ackman
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. Activist hedge fund manager. Pershing Square Foundation active. Effective altruism interest.

rankings.name: Henry Kravis
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. Education and arts focus. Active philanthropist.

rankings.name: Carlos Slim
rankings.notes: Has NOT signed Giving Pledge. Major Latin American philanthropist. Focus on job creation and infrastructure.

rankings.name: Daniel Gilbert
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. Major Detroit philanthropist. Focus on city revitalization, healthcare, education.

rankings.name: Barry Diller
rankings.notes: With wife Diane von Furstenberg, pledged to give $1B+

rankings.name: Jeff Bezos
rankings.notes: Has NOT signed Giving Pledge despite pressure. Announced intent to give away 'most' of wealth in Nov 2022.

rankings.name: He Xiangjian
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. China's most generous philanthropist 2017. Major foundation commitment.

rankings.name: Carlos Slim Helu
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Declined to join, prefers own model. Mexico's leading philanthropist. Focus on sustainable development.

rankings.name: Colin Huang
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Retired early from Pinduoduo. Major philanthropist - topped China giving list 2021.

rankings.name: Dietmar Hopp
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Very generous German philanthropist. One of Europe's largest private foundations. Focus on local region.

rankings.name: Stephen Mandel Jr
rankings.notes: Tiger Cub. Stepped back from Lone Pine 2019. Accelerated charitable giving

rankings.name: Wang Jianlin
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Made China's largest individual donation 2010. Wanda very charitable corporately. Wealth declined from $45B peak.

rankings.name: Stephen Ross
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. Largest donor to University of Michigan. Focus on education and sustainable cities.

rankings.name: Pony Ma
rankings.notes: Has NOT signed Giving Pledge. Major Chinese tech philanthropist. 99 Giving Day initiative.

rankings.name: David Rubenstein
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. Pioneer of 'patriotic philanthropy.' Very public about giving.

rankings.name: Hasso Plattner
rankings.notes: Has NOT signed Giving Pledge. German billionaire. Design thinking and education focus.

rankings.name: Jared Isaacman
rankings.notes: Founded Shift4 at 16. Fighter jet pilot. Led Inspiration4, first all-civilian orbital spaceflight. Exceptionally generous for young billionaire.

rankings.name: Evan Spiegel
rankings.notes: Youngest self-made billionaire when Snap IPO'd. Married to Miranda Kerr

rankings.name: Michael Dell
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge 2010. Major recent giving: $6.25B Trump Accounts pledge. Foundation focuses on education, children's health.

rankings.name: Stanley Druckenmiller
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. Named America's Most Charitable Man 2009. Very generous relative to wealth.

rankings.name: David Geffen
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. UCLA's largest individual donor ($450M+). Focus on education, arts, medicine.

rankings.name: Leon Cooperman
rankings.notes: Goldman Sachs alum. Vocal on billionaire tax. 'He who dies rich, dies disgraced'

rankings.name: Austin Russell
rankings.notes: Stanford dropout. Thiel Fellow. Youngest self-made billionaire at time of IPO (2020). Exceptional giving rate for age.

rankings.name: H. Fisk Johnson
rankings.notes: SC Johnson chairman/CEO. 5th-generation family leadership. PhD from Cornell. Known for environmental leadership.

rankings.name: Ma Huateng
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. One of China's largest philanthropic commitments. Shares pledged to charity foundation.

rankings.name: Charles Koch
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge 2012. $5B+ in stock to nonprofits. Controversial - much giving to political/advocacy causes.

rankings.name: Robert Kraft
rankings.notes: Has NOT signed Giving Pledge. Claims $1B lifetime giving. Focus on youth, health equity, Jewish causes.

rankings.name: Lee Shau Kee
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Hong Kong property magnate. Generous philanthropist. Focus on education and affordable housing.

rankings.name: Michael Milken
rankings.notes: Pardoned by Trump 2020. Fortune says 'man who changed medicine'

rankings.name: David Green
rankings.notes: Hobby Lobby founder/CEO. Evangelical Christian. Won Supreme Court case 2014 on religious exemptions. Focus: Christian education, Bible preservation, ministries.

rankings.name: Marc Benioff
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. Created 1-1-1 model adopted by many companies. Top 10 philanthropist multiple years. Very generous.

rankings.name: Jack Ma
rankings.notes: Has NOT signed Giving Pledge. Major Chinese philanthropist. Lower profile after regulatory issues.

rankings.name: Lei Jun
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. One of China's top philanthropists. $2.2B stock donation was major commitment.

rankings.name: Li Ka-shing
rankings.notes: Did NOT sign Giving Pledge (pledged own version). 'Superman' of Hong Kong business. Third son for philanthropy. Very generous.

rankings.name: Phil Knight
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. 2025 $2B OHSU gift is largest to any US university. Total lifetime giving over $6.7B. Extremely generous.

rankings.name: Hansjorg Wyss
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. $1B for nature conservation. Very generous Swiss philanthropist.

rankings.name: Ronald Perelman
rankings.notes: Wealth declined significantly in recent years

rankings.name: Jack Dorsey
rankings.notes: Novel 'Start Small' LLC approach. Transparent giving tracking

rankings.name: Oprah Winfrey
rankings.notes: First African American on Top Philanthropist list, will leave $1B to charity

rankings.name: Sun Hongbin
rankings.notes: Sunac China founder/chairman. Real estate developer. Fortune crashed in China property crisis. Transferred assets to South Dakota Trust. US citizen.

rankings.name: Laurene Powell Jobs
rankings.notes: Has not signed Giving Pledge. Emerson Collective is LLC structure. Active in education, media, policy.

rankings.name: Pierre Omidyar
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. Omidyar Network model. Focus on democracy and journalism.

rankings.name: Shiv Nadar
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. India's most generous billionaire. Shiv Nadar Foundation for education. Exemplary philanthropy.

rankings.name: Michael Bloomberg
rankings.notes: America's top donor 2023 and 2024. Has given 22% of current net worth. Very active.

rankings.name: Jim Simons
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. Simons Foundation is premier math/science funder. Died May 2024.

rankings.name: Dustin Moskovitz
rankings.notes: Youngest Giving Pledge signer (2010). EA-aligned giving. Very strategic philanthropist.

rankings.name: Andrew Forrest
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge 2013. Australia's most generous. Minderoo Foundation very active.

rankings.name: Donald Bren
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. America's richest real estate developer. Exceptionally generous for wealth level.

rankings.name: Alisher Usmanov
rankings.notes: Has NOT signed Giving Pledge. Major Russian philanthropist. Under sanctions since 2022.

rankings.name: Ray Dalio
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. One of most generous hedge fund managers. OceanX exploration initiative. Connecticut education focus.

rankings.name: Prince Alwaleed bin Talal
rankings.notes: Saudi royal family member. Major global investor. Has pledged entire fortune to charity. Was detained during 2017 Saudi anti-corruption campaign.

rankings.name: Warren Buffett
rankings.notes: Co-founder of Giving Pledge. Pledged 99%+ of wealth. Giving accelerating in recent years.

rankings.name: Amos Hostetter Jr.
rankings.notes: Continental Cablevision founder. Sold 1996. With wife Barbara founded Barr Foundation. Now Pilot House Associates chairman. Focus: Boston, climate, arts, education.

rankings.name: John Arnold
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. EXEMPLARY - given 42% of wealth already. Forbes 5/5 philanthropy score.

rankings.name: Abdulla Al Ghurair
rankings.notes: UAE banking and construction magnate. One of the largest private philanthropic initiatives in Arab world. Built schools in UAE since 1960s.

rankings.name: Roman Abramovich
rankings.notes: Has NOT signed Giving Pledge. £2.5B pledge from Chelsea sale (frozen due to sanctions). Complicated legacy.

rankings.name: Yang Huiyan
rankings.notes: Chairwoman of Country Garden. Stake transferred from father Yang Guoqiang. Was Asia's richest woman. Company in real estate crisis.

rankings.name: Bill Gates
rankings.notes: Co-founder of Giving Pledge. Has given $60B+ personally. Foundation to close by 2045 after deploying all funds.

rankings.name: MacKenzie Scott
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. Has given 82%+ of divorce settlement. Fastest major giving in history.

rankings.name: George Soros
rankings.notes: Has given away 80%+ of peak wealth. One of most generous philanthropists ever relative to wealth.

rankings.name: Azim Premji
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge 2013. EXEMPLARY - among world's most generous. $21B to education. India's most generous philanthropist in history.

rankings.name: Ted Turner
rankings.notes: Signed Giving Pledge. Pioneer - $1B UN gift in 1997 was landmark. Very generous relative to wealth.

deceased.name: Eli Broad
deceased.notes: DECEASED (2021). Among first Giving Pledge signers. $4B+ lifetime. Major LA philanthropist. Education reformer.

deceased.name: Gordon Moore
deceased.notes: DECEASED (2023). Signed Giving Pledge 2012. $5B+ given. One of most generous tech philanthropists ever.

deceased.name: T. Boone Pickens
deceased.notes: DECEASED (2019). Signed Giving Pledge. Gave away most of fortune. OSU's largest donor.

deceased.name: Sheldon Adelson
deceased.notes: DECEASED (2021). Signed Giving Pledge. Mix of charity and political giving. Jewish causes focus.

deceased.name: James Simons
deceased.notes: DECEASED (2024). Signed Giving Pledge. $8.5B+ to science/math. Exemplary philanthropist.

deceased.name: Dietrich Mateschitz
deceased.notes: DECEASED (2022). Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Wings for Life Foundation main philanthropy.

deceased.name: David Koch
deceased.notes: DECEASED (2019). Signed Giving Pledge. Major medical research and arts donor. Controversial political giving.

deceased.name: Leonard Lauder
deceased.notes: DECEASED (2025). Did NOT sign Giving Pledge. Major arts patron. Cubist collection gift valued at $1B+.
